articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Butcher Tali Yehuda says her tears are with the families of those who have perished as she firmly sticks in a pin to secure a yellow sunflower into one of hundreds of wreaths being prepared by volunteers for funerals across Israel.
articles.title: Israeli volunteers prepare hundreds of wreaths for funerals

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British foreign minister James Cleverly took shelter as a siren went off during his visit to Israel on Wednesday, a video clip posted on social media by the Israeli foreign ministry showed.
articles.title: UK's Cleverly takes shelter as siren goes off during Israel visit

articles.author: Emily Rose, Ilan Rosenberg
articles.description: Israeli paramedic Hami Atias has seen much death and gore over 21 years of treating victims of violent attacks, natural disasters and war wounded. But the scene that greeted him at a leafy kibbutz near Gaza at the weekend will haunt him forever.
articles.title: Gore, gunfights and hostage-taking scar kibbutz dwellers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States is continuing to monitor the situation in Israel, U.S. President Joe Biden said, adding that he had spoken with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu earlier on Wednesday, the fourth call between the two leaders in recent days.
articles.title: Biden speaks with Israel's Netanyahu as US monitors situation

articles.author: Idrees Ali
articles.description: The U.S. military has yet to see any sign that other Israeli adversaries are preparing to move against Israel following a surprise attack by the Palestinian militant group Hamas, General C.Q. Brown, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Top US general: No indications other Israeli adversaries to join war

articles.author: Ali Sawafta, Henriette Chacar
articles.description: As Israel declared war on Hamas and pounded Gaza following Saturday's devastating attack by the Islamist movement, violence has risen in the occupied West Bank, risking escalation after more than a year of continuous flare-ups.
articles.title: As Gaza war rages, Israeli forces kill 27 Palestinians in West Bank

articles.author: Ahmed Mohamed Hassan
articles.description: Egypt has discussed plans with the United States and others to provide humanitarian aid through its border with Gaza Strip but rejects any move to set up safe corridors for refugees fleeing the enclave, Egyptian security sources said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Egypt discusses Gaza aid, rejects corridors for civilians, say sources

articles.author: Dan Williams, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Nandita Bose
articles.description: Israel formed an emergency unity government on Wednesday as it pounded Gaza to root out Hamas and deploying forces north of the densely populated Palestinian enclave, where the militants said they were still fighting after their cross-border assault.
articles.title: Israel forms unity government as Hamas armed wing says still fighting outside Gaza

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Israel calls last week's devastating attack by Hamas its 9/11 moment. The secretive mastermind behind the assault, Palestinian militant Mohammed Deif, calls it Al Aqsa Flood.
articles.title: Who is Mohammed Deif, the Hamas commander behind the attack on Israel?

articles.author: Moira Warburton
articles.description: A group of New York state Republicans in the U.S. House of Representatives will introduce a motion to expel indicted fellow Republican George Santos from the chamber, two of the members said on Wednesday.
articles.title: New York Republicans to move to oust George Santos from US House
